title: Unveiling Scaling Behaviors in Molecular Language Models: Effects of Model Size, Data, and Representation
summary: Molecular generative models, often employing GPT-style language modeling on molecular string representations, have shown promising capabilities when scaled to large datasets and model sizes. However, it remains unclear and subject to debate whether these models adhere to predictable scaling laws under fixed computational budgets, which is a crucial understanding for optimally allocating resources between model size, data volume, and molecular representation. In this study, we systematically investigate the scaling behavior of molecular language models across both pretraining and downstream tasks. We train 300 models and conduct over 10,000 experiments, rigorously controlling compute budgets while independently varying model size, number of training tokens, and molecular representation. Our results demonstrate clear scaling laws in molecular models for both pretraining and downstream transfer, reveal the substantial impact of molecular representation on performance, and explain previously observed inconsistencies in scaling behavior for molecular generation. Additionally, we publicly release the largest library of molecular language models to date to facilitate future research and development. Code and models are available at https://github.com/SZU-ADDG/MLM-Scaling.

AI.tldr: 本研究系统地调查了分子语言模型在预训练和下游任务中的缩放行为，揭示了模型大小、数据量和分子表示对性能的显著影响，并解释了先前观察到的分子生成缩放行为的不一致性。
AI.motivation: 传统药物发现流程耗时耗资，而分子生成模型作为一种更高效的替代方案，需要理解在固定计算预算下，模型大小、数据量和分子表示之间的最佳权衡，以及这些模型是否遵循可预测的缩放规律。
AI.method: 研究人员训练了300个模型，进行了超过10,000次实验，严格控制计算预算，并独立改变模型大小、训练token数量和分子表示。他们分析了预训练损失和下游迁移任务的缩放行为。
AI.result: 研究结果表明，分子模型在预训练和下游迁移中都存在明确的缩放规律，分子表示对性能有重大影响，并解释了先前观察到的分子生成缩放行为的不一致性。他们还发布了迄今为止最大的分子语言模型库。
AI.conclusion: 本研究为分子语言模型的训练设计提供了原则性依据，揭示了分子表示对缩放行为的影响，并为未来的研究和开发提供了宝贵的资源，有助于更有效地利用计算资源进行分子设计。

title: A Cross-Domain Graph Learning Protocol for Single-Step Molecular Geometry Refinement
summary: Accurate molecular geometries are a prerequisite for reliable quantum-chemical predictions, yet density functional theory (DFT) optimization remains a major bottleneck for high-throughput molecular screening. Here we present GeoOpt-Net, a multi-branch SE(3)-equivariant geometry refinement network that predicts DFT-quality structures at the B3LYP/TZVP level of theory in a single forward pass starting from inexpensive initial conformers generated at a low-cost force-field level. GeoOpt-Net is trained using a two-stage strategy in which a broadly pretrained geometric representation is subsequently fine-tuned to approach B3LYP/TZVP-level accuracy, with theory- and basis-set-aware calibration enabled by a fidelity-aware feature modulation (FAFM) mechanism. Benchmarking against representative approaches spanning classical conformer generation (RDKit), semiempirical quantum methods (xTB), data-driven geometry refinement pipelines (Auto3D), and machine-learning interatomic potentials (UMA) on external drug-like molecules demonstrates that GeoOpt-Net achieves sub-milli-Å all-atom RMSD with near-zero B3LYP/TZVP single-point energy deviations, indicating DFT-ready geometries that closely reproduce both structural and energetic references. Beyond geometric metrics, GeoOpt-Net generates initial guesses intrinsically compatible with DFT convergence criteria, yielding nonzero ``All-YES'' convergence rates (65.0\% under loose and 33.4\% under default thresholds), and substantially reducing re-optimization steps and wall-clock time. GeoOpt-Net further exhibits smooth and predictable energy scaling with molecular complexity while preserving key electronic observables such as dipole moments. Collectively, these results establish GeoOpt-Net as a scalable, physically consistent geometry refinement framework that enables efficient acceleration of DFT-based quantum-chemical workflows.

AI.tldr: GeoOpt-Net是一种单步分子几何优化网络，能够从低成本力场构象体直接预测DFT质量的分子结构，显著加速DFT计算流程。
AI.motivation: 传统的DFT优化计算成本高昂，限制了高通量分子筛选。该研究旨在开发一种更快速、可扩展的几何优化方法。
AI.method: GeoOpt-Net采用多分支SE(3)-等变几何优化网络，通过两阶段训练策略和fidelity-aware feature modulation (FAFM)机制，实现从低成本构象体到B3LYP/TZVP级别精度的单次前向预测。
AI.result: GeoOpt-Net在ZINC20数据库上的测试结果表明，其能够实现亚毫微米级别的全原子均方根偏差（RMSD）和接近零的B3LYP/TZVP单点能偏差，并且显著提高了DFT收敛率，减少了重新优化步骤和计算时间。
AI.conclusion: GeoOpt-Net作为一种可扩展且物理一致的几何优化框架，能够有效加速基于DFT的量子化学工作流程，为分子设计和材料科学研究提供新的工具。

title: Minimal-Action Discrete Schrödinger Bridge Matching for Peptide Sequence Design
summary: Generative modeling of peptide sequences requires navigating a discrete and highly constrained space in which many intermediate states are chemically implausible or unstable. Existing discrete diffusion and flow-based methods rely on reversing fixed corruption processes or following prescribed probability paths, which can force generation through low-likelihood regions and require countless sampling steps. We introduce Minimal-action discrete Schrödinger Bridge Matching (MadSBM), a rate-based generative framework for peptide design that formulates generation as a controlled continuous-time Markov process on the amino-acid edit graph. To yield probability trajectories that remain near high-likelihood sequence neighborhoods throughout generation, MadSBM 1) defines generation relative to a biologically informed reference process derived from pre-trained protein language model logits and 2) learns a time-dependent control field that biases transition rates to produce low-action transport paths from a masked prior to the data distribution. We finally introduce guidance to the MadSBM sampling procedure towards a specific functional objective, expanding the design space of therapeutic peptides; to our knowledge, this represents the first-ever application of discrete classifier guidance to Schrödinger bridge-based generative models.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为MadSBM的框架，它将肽序列生成建模为在氨基酸编辑图上的受控连续时间马尔可夫过程，通过学习时间相关的控制场，引导生成过程沿着低动作路径，从而避免生成低概率的中间状态。
AI.motivation: 现有的离散扩散和流匹配方法在肽序列生成中存在问题，它们依赖于预定义的腐蚀过程或概率路径，可能导致生成过程穿过低概率区域，需要大量的采样步骤。生物序列对局部扰动非常敏感，手工设计的概率路径可能与功能性肽的流形不一致。
AI.method: MadSBM框架通过以下方式解决问题：1) 定义生成过程相对于生物学驱动的参考过程，该过程由预训练的蛋白质语言模型logits推导得出；2) 学习一个时间相关的控制场，偏置过渡速率以产生从先验到数据分布的低动作传输路径；3) 引入对MadSBM采样过程的指导，以实现特定的功能目标。
AI.result: MadSBM首次将离散分类器指导应用于基于Schrödinger桥的生成模型，能够有效地生成肽序列，并扩展了治疗肽的设计空间。
AI.conclusion: MadSBM提供了一种新的肽序列生成方法，通过控制连续时间马尔可夫过程，避免了生成过程穿过低概率区域，提高了生成效率，并为治疗肽的设计提供了新的可能性。

title: Disentangling multispecific antibody function with graph neural networks
summary: Multispecific antibodies offer transformative therapeutic potential by engaging multiple epitopes simultaneously, yet their efficacy is an emergent property governed by complex molecular architectures. Rational design is often bottlenecked by the inability to predict how subtle changes in domain topology influence functional outcomes, a challenge exacerbated by the scarcity of comprehensive experimental data. Here, we introduce a computational framework to address part of this gap. First, we present a generative method for creating large-scale, realistic synthetic functional landscapes that capture non-linear interactions where biological activity depends on domain connectivity. Second, we propose a graph neural network architecture that explicitly encodes these topological constraints, distinguishing between format configurations that appear identical to sequence-only models. We demonstrate that this model, trained on synthetic landscapes, recapitulates complex functional properties and, via transfer learning, has the potential to achieve high predictive accuracy on limited biological datasets. We showcase the model's utility by optimizing trade-offs between efficacy and toxicity in trispecific T-cell engagers and retrieving optimal common light chains. This work provides a robust benchmarking environment for disentangling the combinatorial complexity of multispecifics, accelerating the design of next-generation therapeutics.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种基于图神经网络的计算框架，用于预测多特异性抗体的功能，并解决了传统序列模型无法区分相同序列但拓扑结构不同的抗体格式的问题。
AI.motivation: 多特异性抗体具有巨大的治疗潜力，但其功能是复杂分子结构的涌现属性，难以通过传统方法进行理性设计。实验数据稀缺进一步加剧了这一挑战。
AI.method: 研究人员首先生成了大规模、真实的合成功能景观，捕捉了生物活性与结构连接之间非线性相互作用。然后，他们设计了一种图神经网络架构，该架构显式编码了这些拓扑约束，并在合成景观上训练该模型，并通过迁移学习将其应用于有限的生物数据集。
AI.result: 该模型能够复现多特异性抗体的复杂功能特性，并通过优化三特异性T细胞激活剂的功效和毒性，以及检索最佳的通用轻链，展示了其实用性。
AI.conclusion: 这项工作提供了一个强大的基准环境，用于解析多特异性抗体的组合复杂性，加速下一代治疗药物的设计。
